sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
Suppose that \(f + h = 2g \) and also it is given that 
\[
	\frac{1}{g } + \frac{1}{i } = \frac{2}{h }
\]
Now, prove that \(f \), \(g \), \(h \), and \(i \) are in proportion.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "It is given that 
\[
	\frac{1}{g } + \frac{1}{i } = \frac{2}{h }
\]
\[
	\frac{i + g }{\input[s1v1]{}i } = \frac{2}{h }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow hi + gh = 2g\input[s1v2]{} 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow hi + gh = (\input[s3v1]{} + \input[s3v2]{} )i 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow hi + \input[s4v1]{}h = fi + hi 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow g\input[s4v2]{} = fi 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{\input[s4v1]{} }{g } = \frac{\input[s4v2]{} }{i }
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "$$\text
This means that $f $, $g $, $h $, and $i $ are in proportion.

Hence proved.
\newline
}$$
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["g", "i"], "text": "$$\text{Upon taking LCM's and cross-multiplying we get $hi + gh = 2gi $}$$"}, {"data": ["f", "h"], "text": "$$\text{Since, it is given that $f + h = 2g$, replacing $2g, we get $ hi + gh = (f + h )i $}$$"}, {"data": ["g", "h"], "text": "$$\text{Upon opening up the bracket and cancelling the common terms on both sides we get $gh = fi$}$$ "}, {"data": ["f", "h"], "text": "$$\text{Upon dividing both sides by $gi$, we get $\frac{f }{g } = \frac{h }{i }$}$$"}, {"data": [], "text": " "}]
